projectDesc.p: The Greenfield Digital Project interprets the story of Bankers Trust Company, a large Philadelphia bank that failed in 1930, through a selection of primary source documents, contextual essays, and teacher resources. The project is part of a larger effort funded by the Albert M. Greenfield Foundation to make HSP's 20th-century holdings more accessible.

list.item: DR. C. E. BEURY, CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD

p.orgName: BANK OF PHILADELPHIA AND TRUST COMPANY

div.p: I desire to add this personal word to the letter of this date which I have joined with Mr. Barker in addressing to you.On this same date, Lewis also sent a letter to stockholders of Bank of Philadelphia and Trust Company.

It has been my desire for a considerable period of time to see our bank consolidated with Bankers Trust Company. It has made notable progress under the leadership of Mr. Barker. He has associated with him a splendid corps of experienced men, and has established exceptionally fine contacts with the business interests of the City. I feel that association with such strong banking interests is of real value to our customers.

Coupled with this is the fact that Bankers Trust Company believes, as we do, in branch banking, - a strong central organization, but with every facility made easily available in each community. We now have nineteen offices, including all of the nine offices which Bank of Philadelphia has maintained. They will be strengthened by consolidation with them of branches heretofore maintained by Bankers Trust Company.

This enlargement of the institution will not mean that you will lose contact with the men with whom you have been accustomed to do business. You will find all your old friends here, and some new ones, who are anxious to become acquainted with you and to serve you. There has been created the North Philadelphia Advisory Board, upon which all directors of Bank of Philadelphia will serve. This will assure intimate and cordial consideration for the established business associations which we have developed with our depositors and other customers.
It is with great confidence in our ability to serve you in every field of banking, investment, title and trust business, that I ask for your continued patronage and friendship.
div.closer: Sincerely yours, L. A. Lewis President.
